oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Virginia Carolina Chemical Company
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Digging equipment being used at the Virginia Carolina Chemical Company.

On September 12, 1895, Samuel Tate Morgan formed the Virgina-Carolina Chemical (Fertilizer) Company, which was headquartered in Richmond, VA. There were also plants located in Durham, NC, Alabama, Florida and Mt. Pleasant, Tenn.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Machinery; Equipment; Digging
